messages.message:
FYI, going to add a label called “Stale” — If the PR hasn’t been touched in 3 weeks and it’s labelled as “Stale” I think we should either “close the PR until it’s ready for review”, commit the code to experimental for later action, or “finish up the PR and get it submitted”

That work for everyone? I’m going to annotate PRs I see as Stale right now
Feel free to move it to another label if you’re still working on it — just trying to keep the number of open PRs small
Sounds like a nice strategy to me (as long as we always label before closing so we can easily go back and find)
this is a good idea IMO.
